name: Courtyard by Marriott DFW Airport South/Irving

reviews.text: Stayed here with a volleyball team. Very clean, great beds, staff well-trained in customer service, nice hot breakfast buffet with omelet station and waffle maker. They accomodated all our unique needs. There is a computer in the lobby with a printer for those "A" boarding passes, as well a fire in the fireplace. We plan to stay there three more times for all our Dallas tournaments.
reviews.title: Marriott does it again
reservation mixup
reviews.text: The hotel made a mistake with reservations, reserving a room for JULY 7 instead of JUNE 7 as we requested.

reviews.title: good dfw hotel
reviews.text: We stayed here two nights in August and would do so again. Very clean hotel close to DFW (especially close to the DFW consolidated rental car facility) with a good (outdoor) pool area, a nice breakfast buffet area, and a very friendly and efficient staff. The weekend rates are a real bargain! It is located right on the 183 highway to Dallas and Fort Worth and just a short drive to highway 360 and Arlington attractions.

This hotel property itself decent and had ample parking, but in terms of location the only thing this hotel is really good for is proximity to DFW and proximity to highway. You really do need a car to stay at this hotel. Other than the hotel cafe/restaurant, there are no restaurants withing walkable distance to the hotel except for a Whataburger on the other side of the highway.
reviews.title: Reasonably priced hotel near DFW but near nothing else

reviews.text: And if you do travel on the highway, don't forget to bring lots of small bills and change because Dallas is notorious for toll roads and nickel and diming you to death.
reviews.title: Friendly Courtyard experience

likes.liked: — Free internet, friendly staff, comfy beds, free airport shuttle

reviews.text: I stayed here before an early morning flight from DFW, and it was a very pleasant experience. I arrived on Christmas night, and the shuttle driver immediately offered to drive me to an open restaurant nearby if I hadn't had dinner yet. The front desk attendant was also very friendly. My room on the 3rd floor was quite large with a king bed and a sitting area. Internet was free. The TV was older, but it was large enough for the room. Bathroom was adequate. The morning of my flight, the shuttle driver was downstairs and ready to go on time. The front desk attendant offered to call the airline and double check the gate. I was really impressed with all the employees, but that seems to be the Marriott way. I definitely recommend staying here before an early flight or a late arrival.
reviews.title: Clean and centrally located.

likes.liked: — Close to Airport and major highways

reviews.text: If you need to be centrally located between Dallas and Fort Worth or close to the airport this is a good option. Easy access to major highways and equidistance between Dallas and Fort Worth. The inside is clean, front desk staff is very friendly and there was some life in the lobby in the bar area if you are traveling alone. The breakfast was your standard Courtyard experience but a nice option before heading out for a day. I was on business but wouldn't suggest this if you are looking for a "real" experience - ie: it is off a major road etc. Overall it is good experience but not a luxurious one!
reviews.title: Friendly Service at this Courtyard

reviews.text: I used Marriott rewards to stay here for free, and our family couldn't have been happier for our 1 night stay near the airport while on our way to Mexico. The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful when we arrived late and needed to have dinner delivered. (BTW, don't order Vito's pizza since it has no flavor!) The room was very modern and comfortable, and the bathroom was great. The breakfast buffet was delicious!
reviews.title: Close to DFW
